result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J. Isham

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: per Atty Schenks office - Marie- OK with restitution - no need to wait the 30 days -
Restitution Summary

Defendant Anthony J. Isham in court with attorney Aaron Schenk.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Called with 16cf78 
State moves to dismiss but read in this case - Granted
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 15, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 11, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Anthony J. Isham in court. Attorney Aaron Schenk appears via telephonically.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also callig 15CF205.  Atty Schenk statement to court - agreement not reached and asks for trial date and time.  Court sets 15CF205 for jury trial and 16CF78 for Status.  Court questions as to how many days needed for Jury Trial - Atty Sowinski states has 2-3 witnessess.  Atty Schenk states only witnes is defendant and that is if he testifies.  Counsel should be prepared to meet in Chambers by 8:15 a.m.  Will set for PTC to see where things are at.  Court will allow Atty Schenk to appear telephonically for PTC  Jury trial scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 15, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
from Atty. Schenk to Judge - PTC adjournment
Pre-trial conference on August 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.
and States Reply to Discovery

4:02 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Isham in court with attorney Aaron Schenk.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 15cf205 and 16cf78.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing in both cases. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek statement that Information in both cases will be filed that will mirror complaints - Schenk willing to proceed to Arraignment in both cases today. Schenk - waives formal reading of Information and enters not guilty pleas to all charges. Bail continued. Adj. 4:06 p.m. Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
and Discovery Demand - includes cover letter
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture - Defendant - "Return to sender - unable to forward"

3:12 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Isham in court with attorney Eric Shenk appearing telephonically with leave of court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf205 and 16cf78 -   In receipt of complaints, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing (in both cases) - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 3:13 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

1:56 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Isham in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf78 and 15cf205.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to forfeit of bond in 15cf205 - Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $10,000 cash bond. Defendant requests $10,000 surety bond to be signed by a family member - Court denies. Adj. 2:03 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Per Nicole at ONSO - in custody in ONSO
per Nicole @ ONSO - detainer - Cameron Cty Texas
Extradition Forecast - Will extradite
2:56 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Isham not in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 2:56 p.m.

3:24 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Isham in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states defendant not eligible for PD or court appointed attorney.  Defendant states he cannot pay for retainer for an attorney until December 18, 2015. Bail continued. Adj. 3:26 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
denied
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 3:23 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Isham in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states awaiting phone call from court appointed attorney.  Contacted PD's office and was denied. Court denied petition for court appointed attorney. Defendant would like to seek private counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

2:05 p.m. Defendant Anthony J. Isham in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
